intro: Pelargonium ocellatum, commonly known as the spotted geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive spotted leaves and clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and blooms. Pelargonium ocellatum is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
